attributes.action: Bring in a 'Filter in turn' system in areas of high traffic congestion.
attributes.background: We've all been there, stuck in a side road waiting to pull out, or at a roundabout where the drivers with right of way aren't giving an inch. This creates animosity and adds stress to an already stressful journey. All anyone wants is a fair system. This system is fair and can be easily introduced.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for all roads in the UK. They are only responsible for motorways and major A roads in England. 

Local roads are the responsibility of your local council. If you're concerned about a local junction, you could raise this with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
